comment: Super disorganized and all lectures were pre recorded from a previous semester. She said multiple times how busy she was and it showed when our midterm still hadnt been graded a day before the semester ended. Lectures are super heavy and you just watch them and read the textbook to do well on quizzes and tests.

She was a great professor who brought new insight from different perspectives. She helped me understand US history in a more interesting way. Her lectures were interesting because of her previous education. Loved learning from her lens and she was very willing to help us and point us in the right direction.

Dr. Grace is a great professor and her online lectures are so funny and enjoyable to watch. theres about 3 hours of content to watch/read each week with a quiz at the end and an occasional discussion board. the only tests we had were a midterm with an essay part and a final. she posted some content late but usually gives an extension if she does.

Highly recommend. She is a bit unorganized, but she is really really nice, and super forgiving. Her lectures are interesting and fun, and the class overall was enjoyable. There's not a lot of homework, either, just do your work and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: i did not like dr. grace at all. very inaccessible. she seems very lazy in terms of posting the weekly content (quizzes were sometimes not posted until the weekend they were due). huge story map project that she set up very weirdly. quizzes weren't hard, but not easy either. i don't recommend dr. watkinson.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Get ready to read

comment: She's my favorite professor here at KSU so far! She's easy-going, very funny, and her lectures are easy to listen to. Quite a lot of assignments, but they're easy to keep up with. I never wanted to miss any class because she made it so fun. The only criticism I have is that she takes a while to grade assignments, but other than that, she's awesome!

Dr. Watkinson (goes by Dr. Grace) is very unorganized. She doesn't follow her syllabus and doesn't post the lesson plan until mid-week and expects het students to complete her weekly quizzes before the next week. She takes a while to grade assignments and exams. Dr. Watkinson rarely checks her emails, or if not that, chooses not to respond to them.

She is very enthusiastic about History and has perhaps the most interesting lectures of any history professor I've ever had. You'll have a weekly quiz based on lectures and reading, as well as a biweekly discussion post which is pretty easy. There's also a biweekly "Museum Portfolio Project" section, but it's pretty easy and not that time consuming
